topic: Generative Foundation Models and AI Developments

  entities:
    Stephen R. Covey|Person
    OpenAI|Organization
    Anthropic|Organization
    Google|Organization
    US government|Organization
    CRFM|Organization
    Stanford HAI|Organization
    Mistral|Organization
    Meta|Organization
    Stable Diffusion|Model
    Llama|Model
    GPT-4|Model
    Claude Series|Model
    ChatGPT|Model
    Palm|Model
    Llama Guard|Model
    Mixtral|Model
    GPT-4o|Model
    Llama 3|Model
    Gemini 1.5 Flash|Model
    Deepseek-R1|Model
    OpenAI o3-mini|Model
    IBM Granite Guardian|Model
    European Artificial Intelligence Act|Regulation
    Seoul Declaration|Report
    International AI Safety Report|Report
    Foundation Model Transparency Index|Report

  proposition: Stephen R. Covey defines trust as the glue of life and the most essential ingredient in effective communication.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Stephen R. Covey|DESCRIBED_BY|trust as glue of life
    Stephen R. Covey|DESCRIBED_BY|trust as essential ingredient in communication

  proposition: Trust is the foundational principle that holds all relationships.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Trust|DESCRIBED_BY|foundational principle
    Trust|HOLDS|relationships

  proposition: Generative models are machine learning models trained to learn underlying data distribution.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative models|TYPE|machine learning models
    Generative models|TRAINED_TO|learn underlying data distribution

  proposition: Generative models can generate new data instances resembling training dataset characteristics.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative models|CAPABILITY|generate new data instances
    Generative models|RESEMBLES|training dataset characteristics

  proposition: Generative models have applications in generating realistic images, texts, and videos.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative models|APPLICATION|generating realistic images
    Generative models|APPLICATION|generating realistic texts
    Generative models|APPLICATION|generating realistic videos

  proposition: Generative models potentially drive advancements in scientific discovery, healthcare, and autonomous systems.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative models|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|scientific discovery
    Generative models|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|healthcare
    Generative models|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|autonomous systems

  proposition: Common generative models include Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), Diffusion Models, and Large Language Models (LLMs).
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative models|INCLUDES|Generative Adversarial Networks
    Generative models|INCLUDES|Variational Autoencoders
    Generative models|INCLUDES|Diffusion Models
    Generative models|INCLUDES|Large Language Models

  proposition: LLMs can generate content often indistinguishable from human-produced content.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    LLMs|CAPABILITY|generate content
    LLMs|DESCRIBED_BY|indistinguishable from human-produced content

  proposition: Foundation models are large-scale pre-trained models serving as general-purpose systems for various downstream tasks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Foundation models|SCALE|large-scale
    Foundation models|TYPE|pre-trained models
    Foundation models|PURPOSE|general-purpose systems
    Foundation models|USED_FOR|downstream tasks

  proposition: Foundation models are distinguished by extensive use of massive datasets and computational resources during pre-training.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Foundation models|DISTINGUISHED_BY|extensive use of massive datasets
    Foundation models|DISTINGUISHED_BY|extensive computational resources
    Foundation models|PHASE|pre-training

  proposition: Foundation models can generalize effectively across diverse applications.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Foundation models|CAPABILITY|generalize effectively
    Foundation models|APPLICABLE_TO|diverse applications

  proposition: Non-generative foundation models like BERT are primarily designed for text classification or language understanding.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    BERT|TYPE|non-generative foundation model
    BERT|DESIGNED_FOR|text classification
    BERT|DESIGNED_FOR|language understanding

  proposition: Generative foundation models (GenFMs) are specifically adapted for generative tasks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative foundation models|ADAPTED_FOR|generative tasks

  proposition: GenFMs excel in creating new instances such as images, texts, or other data forms based on their training.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GenFMs|CAPABILITY|creating new instances
    GenFMs|CREATES|images
    GenFMs|CREATES|texts
    GenFMs|CREATES|other data forms

  proposition: GenFMs are poised to revolutionize industries by pushing boundaries of content creation, decision-making, and autonomous systems.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GenFMs|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|content creation
    GenFMs|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|decision-making
    GenFMs|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|autonomous systems

  proposition: Ensuring trustworthiness of GenFMs has become a pressing concern as they gain widespread adoption.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GenFMs|CONCERN|trustworthiness
    GenFMs|STATUS|widespread adoption

  proposition: OpenAI released GPT-4 in December 2022.
    entity-entity relationships:
    OpenAI|RELEASED|GPT-4
    GPT-4|RELEASED_IN|December 2022

  proposition: Anthropic released Claude Series in October 2022.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Anthropic|RELEASED|Claude Series
    Claude Series|RELEASED_IN|October 2022

  proposition: OpenAI released ChatGPT in November 2022, gaining over 100 million users in two months.
    entity-entity relationships:
    OpenAI|RELEASED|ChatGPT
    ChatGPT|RELEASED_IN|November 2022

  proposition: The European Artificial Intelligence Act entered into force in August & September 2024.
    entity-entity relationships:
    European Artificial Intelligence Act|ENTERED_FORCE_IN|August 2024
    European Artificial Intelligence Act|ENTERED_FORCE_IN|September 2024

  proposition: The Seoul Declaration was adopted at the 2024 AI Seoul Summit in April & May 2024.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Seoul Declaration|ADOPTED_AT|2024 AI Seoul Summit
    Seoul Declaration|ADOPTED_IN|April 2024
    Seoul Declaration|ADOPTED_IN|May 2024
